newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - W.A. News Q1 net profit A$11.89 mln.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - W.A. News Q1 net profit A$11.89 mln.

text.p: West Australian Newspaper Holdings Ltd said on Thursday that net profit in the 1996/97 first quarter was A$11.89 million on sales of A$75.69 million.
Chairman Trevor Eastwood said the weakness in advertising volumes had continued and this was a cause of concern.

The downturn was evident in the 4.5 percent fall in operating revenue in the latest 13 weeks and a 13.6 percent fall in earnings before abnormals, interest and tax to A$21.7 million. Net profit fell from A$14.2 million a year ago, when the quarter consisted of 14 weeks.

Eastwood said the outlook was slightly less buoyant than last year. "However, after taking into account cost reductions and increased revenue, a full year result close to that of last year would seem likely," he said at the annual meeting.

The newspaper publisher, which dominates the Perth market with its West Australian daily broadsheet, achieved a slight rise in 1995/96 (July/June) net profit to A$47.85 million from A$47.12 million a year earlier.
Annual operating profit rose to A$74.87 million from A$69.38 million.
